page.title: 19Transport and traffic.
page.content: It may seem strange to those people who live in high population urban areas, but in rural areas, such as those covered by this part of the survey, there is a great lack of transport! The village of Eartham has a very irregular bus service (two buses a day) to Chichester via all the other villages, although this is a year round service. Villagers and farmers therefore have to rely on their own transport to get them into the more urbanised areas. These usually consist of Land Rovers, Range Rovers and saloon cars. There is no Community bus. The major traffic use is therefore private or farm transport, although Amey Roadstone collect and deliver their sand and gravel along portions of the roads.
